channel.title: attr_table.GAIN question
channel.description:
hi there,hope this is the right category.. I'm working on some loopers,and since I'm more of a beginner, I use code from the factory-objects.
I'm a bit irritated by 'attr_table.GAIN' which is used a lot in table write/read objects, with a lot of bitshifting. when I simply leave out these parts of the code,things seem to work just as well, and my objects are lighter in terms of resources.
am I running into TROUBLE?

item.title: attr_table.GAIN question
item.dc:creator: @rbrt
item.description:
@rbrt wrote:

super,thanks!
the loopers are designed for looping audio,
so I'm going to note that they are meant to be used with 32-bit buffers.

Read full topic

item.title: attr_table.GAIN question
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

Will get in trouble when referencing 8- or 16-bit tables rather than 32bit tables.
I would not expect any performance impact with 32-bit tables.

Read full topic
